actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to House Committee on Rules.

official_title: A bill to permit either House of Congress to disapprove certain rules proposed by executive agencies.

summary.text: Administrative Rulemaking Control Act - Requires public notice of proposed rulemaking, allowance of public participation in such rulemaking, and a public statement of the basis and purpose of any adopted rule. Provides that an administrative rule, the violation of which subjects an individual to a criminal penalty, shall take effect only: (1) if published in the Federal Register; (2) after the expiration of 30 days of continuous session of Congress after the date on which the rule was published; and (3) if neither House of Congress passes a resolution disapproving such a rule. Sets forth procedures governing the consideration of such resolution by the Congress.

titles.title: A bill to permit either House of Congress to disapprove certain rules proposed by executive agencies.
